description: {"blocks":[{"key":"80q9a","text":"This protocol describes our excystment protocol for Fasciola hepatica supplied by Ridgeway Research Ltd. F. hepatica metacercariae (also known as mets or cysts) are supplied attached to Visking tubing with both inner and outer walls intact. This protocol builds upon methodology described by McVeigh et al. (2014) and McCusker et al. (2020) and has been tweaked by many lab members over the years. Our thanks to all who have contributed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":52,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":105,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"uqka","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

funders.funder_name: Developing a 'validation portfolio' to exploit key virulence proteins in Fasciola species for parasite control
LIVER FLUKE MOTOR FUNCTION AND PARASITE CONTROL: EXPLOITING A 'TARGET VALIDATION TOOLBOX' AS A DRUG SCREEN-INTERFACE FOR FLUKICIDE DISCOVERY
Probing in vivo parasite biology in vitro
Exploiting stem cell biology for liver fluke control

guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"8160i","text":"Storage of F. hepatica metacercariae","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":36},{"style":"italic","offset":11,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v80c","text":"When mets are received from Ridgeway Research we move sheets from original sheets into 50 mL falcon tubes in fresh RO water. They are then stored at   until required and the 'sheet is use' is moved into a  falcon tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":149,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":205,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6si3c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fqrs2","text":"Washing watchglasses","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6mqs4","text":"Watchglasses are rinsed with   bleach before rinsing in RO water and dried out before subsequent use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":29,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4jkvh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"A954F7C02F9311EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"15","error":false,"guid":"E92247E02F9311EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"055006A02F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3qkr0","text":"Pipette   50% chicken serum (CS50) onto large petri dish base and lid, spread with finger.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"43mc7","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"300","error":false,"guid":"10E2AC202F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e70f6","text":"Fill petri dish base with   RO water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3n06q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"13D056302F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ahp7d","text":"Gently lift rolled-up met sheet out of tube, place in dish base and unwrap the sheet (ensure you know which way mets are facing).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6sv71","text":"Add   of RO water to petri dish lid to ensure it stays damp. Lay the met sheet onto the lid with mets facing down. NB: avoid bubble formation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"eioql","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"531560802FB511EEB1C31FA6EDAEF88D","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgp6e","text":"Use a scalpel to gently pop required number of mets out of outer wall (assume ~70-75% excystment rate). Outer wall is coloured brown whereas 'popped' mets are translucent. NB. only count viable mets (those with a bilobed appearance following popping).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":172,"length":79}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9na48","text":"Add   water to petri dish lid before moving sheet back to petri dish base (mets facing up).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5cb78","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"2A06AD502F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"baasi","text":"Transfer mets from petri dish lid and base to a watchglass using a serum-lined tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cgri2","text":"Make the following solutions and warm to  :","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":41,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c7sd5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"2F5B6C502F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26etm","text":"Tube 1 – Dissolve   sodium tauroglycocholate in  Excystment Salt Solution in a 15 mL falcon tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":48,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":47,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7nv17","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"2D9308602F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"448A17702F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cnjcs","text":"Tube 2 – Dissolve   L-cysteine in   1/20 N HCl in a 15 mL falcon tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":36,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":18,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":34,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"k6fo","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"20","error":false,"guid":"4951D8B02F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2.5","error":false,"guid":"4CCC32602F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8cs3s","text":"Swirl watchglass to gather mets in centre. Remove as much water as possible without drying out mets.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8iqmo","text":"Add   bleach solution to mets and start timer (time varies between sheets/strains - typically ~2 min 30 s)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e6i3t","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"597C55D02F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6otqb","text":"While bleaching is ongoing add   RO water to a new watchglass and serum line a p100 tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":31,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e8qpj","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"5C8613602F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3r967","text":"As timer approaches 0 swirl watchglass to group mets. As timer hits 0 collect mets in serum-lined p100 tip and move into watchglass with water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9oi62","text":"Swirl mets to group, remove as much water as possible and add another   RO water to wash","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":70,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9ru3g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"6004B2D02F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"al4hb","text":"Repeat step 12 x5.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"41bov","text":"After final wash move mets to fresh watchglass using a serum lined p100 tip in  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1919","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"50","error":false,"guid":"62BE06702F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddhdp","text":"Mix tubes 1 and 2 from step 8 together (some effervesce should be visible). Briefly vortex and ensure that the resulting solution is not cloudy. NB. if cloudy, do not add to worms and remake.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":145,"length":46}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"afbon","text":"Pour mixed solutions onto mets and place clean watchglass on top to reduce evaporation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ednp3","text":"Incubate in a tupperware lunchbox (line base with damp paper towel) for 1 h at  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":79,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"umnd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"674D2B802F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a8va3","text":"Collect NEJs with a p10 and place into pre-warmed RPMI (glass watchglass is best). After collecting excysted worms continue incubation at   and collect newly excysted NEJs at 20 min intervals until 3 h after addition of excystment solutions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":138,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"emr21","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"705221402F9411EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

title: In vitro excystment of Juvenile Fasciola hepatica

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"daj1a","text":"Infectious Agent","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"638jc","text":"F. hepatica  is a category 2 pathogen. The metacercariae is the infectious stage of the life and if ingested can infect humans. Therefore all plasticware that comes into contact with metacercariae or NEJs is disposed of in    bleach.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":223,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"c1lnd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"14A618902F9B11EEAAF66B8857A442C5","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}
